oai_dc:dc.dc:title: NUMERICAL SIMULATION FOR TSUNAMI-HEIGHT REDUCTION USING A VERY LARGE FLOATING STRUCTURE
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Kakinuma, Taro
Nakahira, Tatsuya
Kamba, Takatsugu
Murakami, Takahiro
Nakayama, Keisuke
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: VLFS
tsunami
wave-height reduction
thin-plate
floating-body wave
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The tsunami-height reduction using a very large floating structure, i.e., VLFS, is discussed, with the water waves, interacting with a floating thin-plate, simulated numerically. The final tsunami-height reduction rate increases, as VLFS length, VLFS flexural rigidity, or the wave height of an incident tsunami, is increased. If two VLFSs are utilized, the final tsunami-height reduction rate, also depends on the distance between the VLFSs. In two-dimensional tsunami propagation, another wave propagates to the outside, along the crest line of the main wave, leading to an additional tsunami-height reduction.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: Coastal Engineering Proceedings; No. 35 (2016): Proceedings of 35th Conference on Coastal Engineering, Antalya, Turkey, 2016; waves.24
